text: Salvia judaica is a species of flowering plant in the Lamiaceae family. It is a perennial commonly called Judean sage that is native to Mediterranean woodlands and shrublands, with violet flowers blooming from April–June. ==Notes== == External links== *USDA Plants Profile judaica Category:Flora of Israel Category:Flora of Lebanon Category:Flora of Palestine (region) Category:Taxa named by Pierre Edmond Boissier
title: Salvia judaica
